instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Forensic SWAP
threads.message: Hello everyone. I have a special case (i think so:-) and I do not know if the post belongs here but i try:  I have a macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - logicboard is broken (screwdriver or projectile destroyed the logicboard) and the customer has valuable data stored on it which he will pay everything for to get. I am aware that Nand needs to be moved ... should T2 chip, soc-rom also be swapped? what else to swap to the new logicboard? thanks for the help:-).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Forensic SWAP
threads.message: SSD encryption key is stored on T2...
